item.title: Horror Game to Make Surprise SDCC Appearance Despite Recent Shutdown
item.description:
The beloved horror game Friday the 13th: The Game will reportedly make a surprising appearance at this year’s San Diego Comic Con, despite the game’s online servers being shut down last year. Friday the 13th: The Game is a 2017 asymmetrical survival horror developed by IllFonic and published by Gun Media, based on the popular slasher franchise of the same name, featuring the iconic villain, Jason Voorhees.

It’s transpiring to be a busy year for Jason, with Universal confirming a Friday the 13th haunted house will feature in Halloween Horror Nights 2025. Inspired by the Jason Universe, the haunted house spectacle joins another exciting event for fans of the franchise that’s set to captivate SDCC attendees and horror fans alike.

Reported exclusively by IGN, a Jason Universe panel was confirmed for SDCC 2025, taking place on Friday, July 25, featuring a lengthy exploration of Jason’s history, future plans for the IP, giveaways, and exclusive first looks. The detail that caught gamers’ eyes, however, was confirmation that NECA would be unveiling its new 7.6" Ultimate Savini Action Figure, making it the very first collectible based on Friday the 13th: The Game . The SDCC announcement follows recent rumors of a new Friday the 13th game, as speculation suggested a fresh project could be in the works thanks to a new licensing agreement, and a brand-new figure releasing months after the game was shut down is teasing a comeback.

Friday the 13th: The Game Figure to Be Unveiled at San Diego Comic Con

Friday the 13th: The Game ’s online servers shut down in 2024, following licensing issues with the IP’s creator, Victor Miller. After being discontinued and removed from storefronts, offline modes became the only gameplay left, and fans banded together to say goodbye. A mod, titled Friday the 13th: The Game - Resurrected, aimed to restore the online multiplayer feature through private servers, but the team received a cease and desist letter last year. Nevertheless, the SDCC announcement, combined with the new licensing agreement, has given fans of the game a shred of hope.

Friday the 13th: The Game wasn’t the only horror title to face the gauntlet, as Evil Dead: The Game was subject to delisting this year by developer Saber Interactive. The Ash Williams-led title shares the same genre with IllFonic’s gem, despite only lasting three years compared to Friday the 13th ’s seven. While horror fans will be donning their hockey masks to tune into SDCC’s Jason Universe panel, keeping their fingers crossed for the game’s resurrection, Evil Dead enthusiasts can look forward to the ongoing cinematic offerings, the next being 2026’s Evil Dead Burn .

Friday the 13th: The Game

Top Critic Avg: 61 /100 Critics Rec: 19%

May 25, 2017

item.title: Blue Archive: Best PvP Characters, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Pull for powerful characters to build a strong team in Blue Archive PvP.
  • Hoshino, Shun, and Serina stand out as top picks for PvP effectiveness.
  • Koharu, Himari, and Tsubaki excel in missions with unique abilities.

The PvP mode present in Blue Archive provides an extensive tactical space of play, with different characters being best suited to certain roles, such as tanks, attackers, healers, and supports, all of which have to complement one another to be effective as a whole. Virtually all the characters in this list are effective in high-level team compositions, but each has enough special properties that make them strong options in almost any given comp.

Whether it be durable tanks, high-impact attackers, or all-rounder healers, this list of eight has more than shown their colors in PvP. Starting from strong to very OP in PvP, all of them are crowned with what makes them indispensable to those who aim to become the champion.

8 Hoshino (Battle)

Tanky Crowd-Control With CC Power

Role

Tank

Attack Type

Mystic

Combat Class

Striker

Hoshino introduces stability plus sabotage, with gun skills that dominate the positioning of enemies. Her EX skill is a backblow that stuns the opponent in an area, making it perfect to stop rushes and create team dynamics in that situation. Hoshino is strong when paired with big numbers and shield synergy, and helps to use the positioning of the opponents, exploited by teammates in a 2-tank composition.

A great boost in Outdoor PvP, Hoshino is capable of pushing forward mobs at the frontline, making room for the backliners. Together with a durable tank such as Tsubaki, she will contribute to controlling the maps and will punish blatant advances; hence, she is a stable initiator and offensive force.

7 Shun

SP Battery and Backline Threat

Role

Attacker

Attack Type

Explosive

Combat Class

Striker

Shun is a dual-threat: she starts matches with bonus SP and delivers precise, crit-rich attacks. Her EX skill attacks the enemy with the most attacks and can repeatedly destroy backliners, usually in one hit, before they can retaliate. Such an opening burst also charges the cycle of teammates, so Shun is an essential part of the burst comps.

This is an attacker that is good at shutting down enemy planning first: her early SP can execute doubles on the first turn, and her very high crit load severely weakens sloppy formations. First move advantage can be a determining factor in PvP, and Shun has a reputation for providing powerful openings.

6 Serina

Fast, Efficient, Effective Healing

Role

Healer

Attack Type

Mystic

Combat Class

Special

Although Serina is low-ranked, she compares well with other healers when playing PvP. Her economic EX skill offers focused healing and repositioning of her teammates within the battlefield so that important allies have higher chances of survival. She has healing scales that give special equipment to increase recovery chances and extend the length of endurance for a team.

Serina is in conservative or aggressive comps. She is an excellent choice as an addition to PvP because her cooldown is short, and players only need to spend minimal resources on her. A low investment and high-impact, it is a pick that is very much underutilized at high-ranked plays.

5 Koharu

Resurrection Meets AoE Sustainability

Role

Healer

Attack Type

Explosive

Combat Class

Striker

Koharu is unique because she can resurrect fallen teammates during the match, making otherwise winning moments into opportunities to turn things around. With the right balance of healing and resurrection skills, and a low cost of those skills, she makes an effective, stand-out healer in PvP fights.

Koharu is most suited to protracted battles as it has sustained performance even in stressful moments. She synergizes with other tanks such as Tsubaki, making stall comps viable, which can outlast bursty attackers, and sway the balance of the match towards her team.

4 Himari

Attack-Boosting Catalyst With Teamwide Synergy

Role

Support

Attack Type

Penetration

Combat Class

Special

Himari is not only a support, but also the promoter of destruction. Her aura greatly affirms the attacking capability of her teammates, which maximizes the strength of attackers and other heavy hitters in the team. These buffs render otherwise sub-par DPS units to cannon-like levels of hitting power.

Himari takes ordinary damage into the match-deciding offense on power-forward teams. Her existence turns defense into proactive compositions where every PvP composition gets a dose of power along with a knockout punch capability.

3 Tsubaki

Invincible Frontline Wall

Role

Tank

Attack Type

Penetration

Combat Class

Striker

Tsubaki comes on top of the tank picks with her ridiculous amount of durability and usefulness in PvP. Her EX skill taunts the enemies and greatly increases their defenses, forcing her enemies to attack her to protect their helpless allies.

She also has self-healing, and it takes effect when her HP is low and, in most cases, negates near-death. Also, her reload mechanic reduces damage received. According to PvP lovers, leaving Tsubaki out is a mistake: she is a part of almost every optimal build.

2 Ako

Hybrid Healer with Crit-Damage Power

Role

Support

Attack Type

Mystic

Combat Class

Special

Ako is a blend between healing support and offensive usage. Her EX skill increases the crit damage to allies and recovers HP over time. She is cheap and efficient at cycling, which makes her a staple in aggressive comps.

Ako opens high-reward, high-danger team compositions with the ability to boost burst capability but keep healing safety nets. She is loved because she can keep front-line powerhouses and back-line snipers both active, bringing both damage and sustainability.

1 Iori

Backline Executioner and PvP Dominator

Role

Attacker

Attack Type

Penetration

Combat Class

Striker

Ranking regularly in the top tier, Iori brings unreal amounts of piercing damage, especially with her EX skills. Her 3-shot EX plus a splash means she is a one-woman demolition company. She is especially powerful at destroying the tanks of the opponent and revealing the backliners within one shot.

With comp inclusion such as SP boosters like Shun or specialist buff assist support like Hibiki, Iori becomes unstoppable. High precision, power, and fun to use describe PvP meta dominance, and it mostly always tops the charts for PVP.
